alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Crane; Ector; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Upton; Ward (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued February 16 at 9:24PM CST until February 16 at 10:15PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northwestern Glasscock County in western Texas... Eastern Ector County in western Texas... Southeastern Andrews County in western Texas... East central Ward County in western Texas... Midland County in western Texas... Western Howard County in western Texas... Martin County in western Texas... Crane County in western Texas... Western Upton County in western Texas... * Until 1015 PM CST. * At 923 PM CST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Lenorah to 16 miles north of Midland to 10 miles south of Odessa to 13 miles west of Crane, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 98 and 173. Locations impacted include... Midland, Odessa, Crane, Greenwood, Stanton, Lomax, Lenorah, Midland International Air and Space Port, Luther, West Odessa, Cotton Flat, Midland Airpark, Penwell, Knott, Stanton Municipal Aiport, Tarzan, Midkiff, Crane County Airport, Warfield and Skywest Airport. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.

area.areaDesc: Andrews; Crane; Ector; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Upton; Ward
